DOCNAME: CASE OF SYLENOK AND TEKHNOSERVIS-PLUS v. UKRAINE
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 3;Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Violation of P1-1
JUDGES: Ganna Yudkivska;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant ( “ the applicant ” ) was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . The second applicant ( “ the applicant company ” ) is a limited liability company owned by the applicant and registered and based in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested in the street by plain - clothes police officers – Mr S. , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON The applicant resisted his arrest , being unaware at the time that they were police officers . According to the applicant , during the arrest and later on at the police station he was beaten by the police officers .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was hospitalised with a broken rib , pneumothorax , head concussion and numerous bruises on his body . A forensic medical examination conducted DATE and DATE revealed numerous bruises on different parts of the applicant 's body and brain concussion . At the same time it did not confirm that the applicant had a broken rib .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to ORG ( the CCPO ) about the beatings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the CCPO refused to institute criminal proceedings in respect of the applicant 's allegations . It noted that according to the explanations of the police officers the applicant had violently resisted his arrest and therefore they had applied force and had used handcuffs . Furthermore , the police investigator Mr PERSON had explained that he and other police officers had not committed any unlawful actions involving the applicant at the police station . Therefore , it concluded that the use of force against the applicant had been lawful .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( the CRPO ) quashed the decision of DATE owing to incompleteness of the investigation and instructed the CCPO to conduct additional investigative actions , including questioning of the applicant and detailed questioning of each police officer involved in the incident about the circumstances of the applicant 's arrest and the individual actions of each police officer involved .

CARDINAL . An additional forensic examination of DATE concluded that the applicant had numerous bruises resulting from the application of force CARDINAL to CARDINAL times , a broken rib , chest trauma , pneumothorax and brain concussion .

CARDINAL . On DATE the CCPO refused to institute criminal proceedings on the ground that , as it transpired from the testimony of the police officers involved in the incident , they had applied force lawfully during the arrest and had not used any unlawful means against the applicant in detention .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Chernigiv ORG ( ORG ) quashed the decision of DATE on the ground that the applicant and eyewitnesses to the incident had not been questioned and that the decision of the CCPO had not established the circumstances in which the applicant had received so many injuries . The court ordered criminal proceedings to be instituted in the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the CCPO started the criminal investigation . Between CARDINAL May and DATE CARDINAL witnesses were questioned .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the applicant was summoned CARDINAL times by the investigator but failed to appear .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was found guilty of inflicting medium bodily harm on CARDINAL of the arresting officers – PERSON This decision was upheld on appeal but quashed in cassation proceedings on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal proceedings into the infliction of bodily harm on the applicant were suspended for failure to identify the offenders .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the decision on suspension of the criminal proceedings and they were resumed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was summoned by the investigator but failed to appear .
CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL witnesses were questioned .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was recognised as a victim in the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was questioned as a victim .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE CARDINAL witnesses were questioned .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant failed to appear for questioning . On this date and further on CARDINAL and DATE the investigator ordered that the applicant be brought before him ( примусовий привід ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE the cross - examination between the applicant and PERSON , and police officers PERSON , PERSON , PERSON . , PERSON and PERSON , took place .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the criminal proceedings were suspended for failure to identify the offenders .
CARDINAL . On DATE the CRPO quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE on the suspension of criminal proceedings . The proceedings were resumed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator requested the applicant to provide him with the medical documents concerning the incident in order to conduct an additional forensic medical examination . According to the Government , the applicant did not provide the documents requested .
CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal proceedings were suspended for failure to identify the offenders .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE on the suspension of criminal proceedings . The proceedings were resumed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator ordered that the applicant be brought before him . At this time the applicant was detained in the PERSON in connection with other proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal proceedings were suspended for failure to identify the offenders .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the decision of DATE on the suspension of criminal proceedings . The proceedings were resumed .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the applicant was summoned by the investigator but failed to appear .
CARDINAL . On DATE one witness was questioned .
CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal proceedings were suspended for failure to identify the offenders .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the decision of DATE on the suspension of criminal proceedings . The proceedings were resumed .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE CARDINAL CARDINAL witnesses were questioned .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG terminated the criminal proceedings for lack of corpus delicti in the actions of the police officers . The ORG noted that most of the witnesses , owing to the significant lapse of time , could not remember details of the incident and that the original testimonies of the police officers were correct and these officers had acted in accordance with the law .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( the ORG ) quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case for an additional investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL and DATE the applicant was summoned by the investigator but failed to appear .
CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal proceedings were suspended for failure to identify the offenders .
CARDINAL . On DATE , CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicant was summoned by the investigator but failed to appear .

CARDINAL . Since DATE , when the applicant was placed on the list of wanted persons in the context of another criminal case in which he was a defendant , the applicant has failed to appear on summons of the investigator .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG received the medical documents from the applicant and on DATE the forensic medical examination was ordered .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG awarded the applicant company ( from the ORG budget ) CARDINAL NORP hryvnias ( ORG ) in damages , ORG CARDINAL in fees and UAH CARDINAL.CARDINAL in costs and expenses . On DATE the judgment became final and on CARDINAL DATE the court issued a writ of enforcement .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company lodged the writ with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiffs ' service refused to enforce the judgment of DATE owing to non - compliance of the enforcement writ with the formalities .
DATE . On DATE the applicant company lodged the same enforcement writ with ORG , which rejected it DATE for lack of jurisdiction .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company lodged the writ with ORG , which rejected it DATE , as the enforcement writ did not indicate the debtor or its location .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company requested ORG to specify in the enforcement writ the accounts of ORG from which the awarded amounts should be paid .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court rejected the applicant company 's request on the ground that the representative of the ORG had not appeared and the other parties did not know the accounts , nor were they indicated in the case - file materials .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company repeatedly requested the court to bring the enforcement writ into compliance with the formalities . This request was rejected on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company lodged the same request with the same court once again .
CARDINAL . According to the ORG , the judge of ORG invited the representative of the applicant 's company to the court to provide explanations , but the representative failed to appear .

CARDINAL . Relevant domestic law concerning the applicant 's case can be found in the judgment in the case of PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) . Relevant domestic law concerning the applicant company 's complaints is summarised in PERSON v. GPE ( no . PERSON , § § DATE , DATE ) .
